Reviews.Title: Really fun
Reviews.Author: Lani
Reviews.Content: I give this 4 stars because it is a bit bulky, the materials feel pretty cheap and it feels a bit like a toy camera. The little latch in the back to open the camera and insert the zink paper is really flimsy. I accidentally bumped it once and all the papers fell out. The power button on top can easily be accidentally toggled as well. I've resorted to keeping a rubberband around the body to keep it from opening. It is only a little bit inconvenient that in order to review your pictures you have to move over the little slider to the playback option, much like older cameras, rather than a playback button - but that's just a minor complaint.Other than that, for $160, you get a fully functioning 10 mp camera. The pictures look much better on the computer than what you see on the LCD screen. The prints are pretty good, though definitely not film quality. This camera is to be used more for fun and you should not expect anything close to professional quality. You do get a few cool options, like color selection when taking photos, and a few frames when you print the pictures. It also takes 720p video which is always nice.Definitely a fun camera and if you buy the paper online, prints are pretty cheap.

Reviews.Title: Great for scrap-booking
Reviews.Author: Jenjen "Jenjen"
Reviews.Content: If you like using your phone to take instagrams your going love this camera!  Insert sd card and choose the prints you want to print.  Sticky backed photos perfect for scrapping.  You can also upload to Mac or windows and print off larger images.  Best of all, the instant camera prints are only 50 cents a piece.  Not bad for instant crafting.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Old School Memories
Reviews.Author: E. Flores
Reviews.Content: This camera was an early Christmas gift last year and I find it perfect for what I need. I wanted a camera that took digital pictures, had expandable memory, was easy to use, and printed out pictures directly from the unit. The Polaroid Z340 Polaroid Z340 3x4 Instant Digital Camera with ZINK (Zero Ink) Printing Technology was too much money and bigger in size than I wanted and the Polaroid 300 Polaroid PIC-300P Instant Film Analog Camera (Purple) didn't have the memory ability I was looking for.After some research of this and the Fuji Instax instant camera line, I settled on this one because of a couple of things.PROS:1) The Polaroid Z2300 has the throwback design that ultimately made it more portable than the Fuji Instax cameras. Yes, it is bigger than many purely digital cameras but you have to take into consideration that it has the printer inside. I have no issue with their being actual buttons, at times it is easier for me than having a touchscreen.2)User friendly memory. I got a 16gb sd card as a promotion and it serves me to be able to selectively print pictures than to just have them print immediately after taking them. I am not the world's best photographer and I wasted many an instant camera in high school due to my lack of skills. Nothing sucked more than finally getting everyone together in the perfect pose at the dance than to press the shutter and find my last picture was already taken :( I have been able to successfully transfer photos from my computer to the sd card to print from Facebook and other cameras, and have also used my phone's micro sd with an adapter to make prints directly using this camera.Some photos do not show up because they are too high resolution (12MP is where I maxed out.) The Polaroid Z2300 only likes landscape, otherwise you get an error message and cannot print. I set my Polaroid Z2300 at 8MP and the pictures come out nice, very little gets cropped in the printing process. My new phone (HTC ONE 32GB)takes true landscape pics and I found that it will fit the entire picture in the print, but the pictures come out "letter boxed" at the top and bottom with white bars (see customer pics for mine.)The ability to take video was another selling point as I do not always have enough battery or memory available on my phone to take HD videos. The format is .avi and to my amateur pov looks good, definitely HD quality. Be warned that the video takes up A LOT of memory and the camera only takes up to 32GB SD cards.3) INSTANT MEMORIES! I love that I can just print out a picture and touch it, use it,  rub it and none of those things will mess it up after it's done. The fact that it is also a sticker makes making albums and Smashbooks easier. I have given them out as gifts to friends, use it to make going away presents for coworkers and it has been handy to use as "wallets" like back in the day. My little cousins personalized backpacks and for an avid Disneyland visitor like me, having prints of those memories is priceless.CONS:1) Picture quality is not always the best, you have to learn what setting works for what scene. This may be a hassle for some people but since I choose what pictures to print and save, not so much of a dealbreaker, just wanted to point it out to others. Colors are either brilliant and spot on, or slightly orangey. They look better on the computer than the camera's LCD screen. Printouts also can come out washed out but it depends on the picture taken in my pov.2) Battery life not so good when printing multiples. It tends to run out faster when I am just in a printing  session and unfortunately taking out the camera battery deletes the date/time setting, which you have to set before being able to take pictures. The battery is removable though but it does charge through ac adapter only. I have yet tried to charge it through usb. Mine came with all these plug adapters for different countries, which may be useful for those that travel, but I just stored them in the junk drawer. I do plan on getting a new battery for just in case.3)You will not find ZINK Premium photo papers Polaroid 2x3" Premium ZINK Photo paper - 50-Pack in stores. I have been able to order some off Amazon but if I run out, I cannot just go to the store and get more. Keep that in mind if you are wanting this camera for crafting purposes or events. The paper itself is cheap and I haven't wasted more than a handful in the past year. I believe around $0.50 a print.If you want a fun camera that helps you shares memories in a unique way, I recommend this camera. This is a gadget in all the sense of the word, not something professional photographers or nitpickers should get, because you will be disappointed. Figure out if your needs are what this camera can give you, because I am thoroughly happy with mine and will be giving one to my cousin now that the price has gone down.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful little camera
Reviews.Author: Andrea de la Pena
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use for my wedding.  We had a photo guest book so people could take their own pictures and put them in our book.  This camera was very user friendly and the quality of the photos was great too.  Perfect for our intended use.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Joan
Reviews.Content: im not a photographer, but i think the pictures come out pretty well. you do have to purchase an extra sd card and more paper refills, but it was worth it. i love it and i would recommend it to many people.

Reviews.Title: works great- but low memory/battery
Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: Works well for our purposes, but the memory and battery life is low and the pictures come out off color from what is shown on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: B. Gerber
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera as a simple one for my wife to use. Unfortunately, the camera lacks some key capabilities for a camera in it's price range:No auto focus - the 3 zone focus switch found on less expensive Polaroid instant cameras should have been replaced by full auto focus. My wife inevitable gets frustrated trying to set the focus correctly.Poorly conceived switching between shooting and image viewing mode - when even $60 digital cameras have a little button to go into image viewing mode and return to shooting mode when you depress the shutter button, Polaroid chose to use a switch like the one for focus selection. My wife constantly complains about missing shots because she forgot to switch the camera back to shooting mode.The camera is bigger than I expected. The photos of the camera and the small size of the printer paper make it look like it's smart phone thin. It's not. It's over 4 1/2 inches long, 3 inches wide and nearly 1 1/2 inches thick. It's also pretty heavy at 11 ounces with battery and printing paper.The battery doesn't last all that long, especially if you print out your pictures, and I don't see why anyone would buy this camera, if they didn't expect to print pictures directly from the camera. The battery had to be recharged before we took and printed a 10 sheet pack of paper.The printed pictures are quite small and the quality is not that good. Pictures with flash are especially poor.

Reviews.Title: Poor Image Quality and Clunky Design
Reviews.Author: Landed Photography
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a novelty item but expected something better than a marginal device.  The camera's sensor is on par with a 2009 cell phone camera; granted, I didn't expect stellar images and in no way was this intended to replace my DSLR, but I had hoped that images viewed on a computer would be at least decent.  Not so.  Images in low light are very difficult to accomplish and the flash doesn't help with the results (muddy, grainy prints.The 'fun' part of the camera is printing images on the paper which double as stickers - while it is neat to be able to print images immediately, the glitz wears off once you realize that the images fade very rapidly - I took some pictures of employees at work when I first bought the camera and now the images are just blue blobs that resemble the employees.  The printing does work, but as others have mentioned, the printing function kills the battery.  Another unfortunate feature is that the proprietary charging cable is lost (as in my case), there doesn't seem to be an easy way to get one - I imagine I will have to call Polaroid because the cable is not available on Amazon or the Polaroid website.I gave the camera two stars because there is a certain level of fun when first using the camera and if you don't take it too seriously, it does deliver a good time and if the camera is for a kid, for example, they will overlook the menus, the size of the camera, etc.  Of course, at $200, this is a pretty expensive toy - mine has been on a shelf for months and it doesn't look like a need is going to come up for me to want to use it again.

Reviews.Title: Great for a teenager
Reviews.Author: R. Ciccone
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that this is a great gift for a teenager. We gave the camera to our niece and she loved it. The digital camera option and the instant photo option are great for her. She will be using it for school events, parties with friends and general outings. She really likes that the pictures double as stickers.Now for the not so good part. We ordered this product through Amazon but I think they fulfilled the order via third party. So when we got the camera, it had been opened, photos taken on it (digital ones) and you could clearly tell that the quality control  by the third party and amazon is not there. Fortunately the product works and our niece was okay with it having been opened, however we are sorely disappointed that Amazon lacks quality control even with third party dealers. Fun camera, not a fun amazon experience.

Reviews.Title: Not the Same
Reviews.Author: Mochene
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a Christmas present and the recipient didn't like the quality. Not nearly as good as the original camera, even though it is digital technology.

Reviews.Title: Ugh.
Reviews.Author: Giggle Rocket
Reviews.Content: The photos keep turning out blue.Pretty cool camera although the quality of photos are pretty messy..I suggest getting in a store and test it out.

Reviews.Title: Fun point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Jeff Ray
Reviews.Content: On an impulse I bought for my daughters' birthday party.  Well I really bought it to have some fun with.  It is a digital point and shoot that prints but has some limitations.  Many have mentioned build and photo quality.  I found both just fine.  My biggest issue is limp flash.  It cannot overcome dim lighting.  But with digital screen you can see and just take picture again under some light.My daughters and their friends liked the photos with colorful borders.  A nice add on in the print menu.The SD card slot is a plus.  I put in an unused card I had in my desk drawer and it worked after some fiddling in the menu.  The instructions are 3 pages and do not explain the menu functions.  However, a little trial and error suffices as it is not all that complicated.I intend to carry it in my backpack and play with it some.  Imagine at some point soon, it will end up belonging to one of my daughters.

Reviews.Title: Horrible quality
Reviews.Author: L. Kurth
Reviews.Content: Poor construction, poor image quality. Definitely not worth the $$$. This should be a 40.00 camera, not almost 200.00. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: Polaroid Bad Business Policy
Reviews.Author: Melissa Ng Pack
Reviews.Content: Hi,I am unable to write a review of this camera because I have only received defective cameras. I purchased the first from Best Buy and exchanged for a new one after the one I received wouldn't load the printer paper.The second one I received was also defective, however since it was pass the original 14 day return policy, there was nothing I could do about it. However, the camera was still under Polaroid warrantyI just contacted Polaroid and they not only will have me pay for the shipping of the replacement camera, but have told me that the replacement I will be receiving is under the warranty from the first camera, so if the 3rd camera I receive is also defective...I am basically screwed.I basically am betting ~7.99 (S&H;) that this new camera is not defective as well.Overall, this is a bad business policy and I would not trust a company that would not renew a warranty when a replacement product is issued.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Kayla
Reviews.Content: This camera did not live up to my expectations. Its very bulky, which i guess isnt to bad because it does print pictures instantly. But compared to a regular digital camer this is very poor quality. It feels cery cheap. And the quality of the pictures printed from it are not very good. I returned mine about 2 days after i got it  it was not worth the money. I got a fujitilm instax mini for $60 and it is much better quality than this camera

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: kimberly
Reviews.Content: was a gift for teen  who just loves it.  It is amazing... all this cammera can do!  I would reccomend this to everyone!

Reviews.Title: It works great!
Reviews.Author: Jenna
Reviews.Content: The quality of the pictures isn't perfect, but they are good enough.  It's just some of the coloring that is off when they print, but it takes great digital pictures and I have always wanted a Polaroid and this one does the trick for my price range.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Scott Forest
Reviews.Content: No ink, digital images better than expected, decent low lighting shots.  I really can't complain about this camera.  Obviously I didn't expect much, but I am very pleased!I didn't think it would get much use but it quickly turns into the life of the party when you start printing out the pix!

Reviews.Title: no
Reviews.Author: Lucy de Anda
Reviews.Content: i got it for christmas and by the end of my trip it was broken. every single time i turned it on it would print out a piece of the paper, which took forever and got really annoying. then it just wouldnt print at all, even when i wanted it too.

Reviews.Title: This is a must have!!!
Reviews.Author: Dan White
Reviews.Content: I bought my wife one of these and she loves it. It prints a photo in less than a minute and the quality is exellent. You can also save the photo and print from a normal photo printer for higher quality and a bigger size "The 2X3 is actually great for on the go". There is also the neat feature of puting SD cards from other cameras in this and using it as a pogo printer so you always have a photo printer on hand. I highly recommend this product for the price. The film/paper isn't expensive and makes for fun stickers if you want.

Reviews.Title: This camera is so much fun
Reviews.Author: wabanzi
Reviews.Content: I took this to a party and everyone wanted a picture.  The quality of the instant prints are just fine.  The digitals are quite good.  I have also had some of the digital printed and they are very nice.I used POGO 2x3 papers (cheaper) and the premium photo papers (expensive) and can not tell the difference between the two.

Reviews.Title: just ok
Reviews.Author: Debi Dapice
Reviews.Content: Not very high quality images. I use this on a daily purpose for work but would not like to have it for personal use. The photos print with a green/blue hue.

Reviews.Title: Blast from the past
Reviews.Author: sarah garrison
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short and to the point. This is a great camera for the nostalgic types out there that like the esthetics of the vintage feel of the modern spin on the old Polaroid cameras. It is not by any means for serious photographers or anyone that wants to take a family portrait! The pictures come out a bit fuzzy and the focus is how steady your hands are. It's fun just to take to a party to record for memories and to actually print out the picture in front on your friends/ family will blow their mind!:) enjoy.

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: Monya Williams
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this camera, quick and easy instructions for the "how to's" no film came with it, but I ordered it on amazon prime and it was delivered in 2 days.  I love that the camera has a digital screen on the back not like the old polaroid cameras where you have to peek through a hole to see what you are photographing.  It also came with charges for any country you may be using it in.  thank you

Reviews.Title: Didn't like it
Reviews.Author: shina lee
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be a wonderful idea for a wedding guest book but the quality of the pictures were poor and it was too small. I was pretty disappointed and decided to return it. It's a wonderful concept in the sense that you can print whichever pictures you want without wasting film like other polaroids and save them. I wish the quality was better!

Reviews.Title: POS
Reviews.Author: Sam Woolsey
Reviews.Content: Great idea and the printed product is something that I expected. But the camera is akin to my first digital camera about 20 years ago. Seriously, it's poor at best. there is zero stability control so you have to have very steady hands. Features = zero and the biggest issue I have with it is that it is incredibly latent. from the time you press the shutter activate button to the time it focuses and the shutter goes, it's nearly 2 seconds which is eons.it's an unusable product IMHO.

Reviews.Title: Great for scrapbooking
Reviews.Author: Ansem
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife. Our son is due any day and I know she has been dying to make a scrapbook. well, this is the perfect camera. Ok, so you aren't going to get super duper mega fine picture quality, but it isnt bad either. Its perfect for its size and may I add INSTANT PRINTING? Thats right. You dont believe me, just look this camera up on a youtube video. Its a cute little camara and I would totally recommend this for anyone who wants that old polaroid feel.

Reviews.Title: A Party Favorite
Reviews.Author: Wicker Paradise Ltd.
Reviews.Content: Great to have at family gatherings, celebrations. Give the gift of instant pictures to your family and friends right on the spot.It's a must have for our 10 top essentials for throwing amazing outdoor parties![...]

Reviews.Title: Fun, Fun, Fun
Reviews.Author: jennifer manz
Reviews.Content: This was a big hit when I went back home for the holidays. It was very easy for everyone to use and the kids (the big kids too) loved watching the pictures develop instantly.I only have one minor complaint. When I try to delete pictures on the memory card, I can't. I hit the button marked with the trash can but I have not been able to erase unwanted pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Monica de la Garza
Reviews.Content: I gave my daughter this camera for Xmas and we love it! At first it looks and feels a bit like the first round of digital point and shoot cameras... A bit bulky with simple menu options... But once you start printing straight off of the camera it is such a rush you're actually amazed it is so compact! Everyone asks her about it and then ask me how much I paid for it. Considering how much fun we're having... It was worth every penny. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the film is not readily available. I've only found online stores that sell it. Here's a tip though... The old POGO film works with this camera and is cheaper than the Z2300 film.

Reviews.Title: Lovely Camera~!
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 3 days now and I love it! The colors are fantastic on the pictures that I print although they are a little bit off they are still very accurate.  The optical zoom isn't very good, its not exactly zooming in. It's just enlarging the picture and cropping it. The ten megapixel are lovely though. The printing time for the picture isn't long at all usually a few seconds and ta-dah you have a printed picture. I would definitely recommend this camera. The cost of the films isn't very costly compared to some other polaroids. It's $25 for 50 sheets. You can also select which picture you would like to print which is great. It's not very heavy and really it's not too thick, it's about the length of your thumb (unless you have really, really big thumbs). It's also great for kids with a simple(ish) software to take pictures. Over all I recommend this camera for sure! Although beware this style of camera is only 5 megapixels in best buy and is only 10 megapixels on amazon. Lovely camera, I love it, 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: Fun for what it is
Reviews.Author: moonspiralz
Reviews.Content: This camera fits a unique niche. The image quality is just ok as a point and shoot and the real fun of the camera is the printer. It's a tad pricey for what it is but, it certainly is a lot of fun. I've taken it to a couple parties where it does just fine snapping pictures and the ability to print on the spot and hand over the picture is a nice throwback to the old poloroid days. The menu system is laughably archaic but, it does the job. I'm not sorry I purchased it however, I suspect I will only use it a few times a year.

Reviews.Title: Good For Play
Reviews.Author: CDAVILA2830
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for someone who loves snapping shots and just having fun with their camera. It's perfect for scrap booking and the kids love sticking the pictures all over there stuff. Cons of this camera are lighting ... you need good lighting in the room or outside in order to have a half decent picture. You are able to lighten up before you take a picture but it doesn't help much. Natural lighting is by far best for this camera. And even with natural lighting I still set it up a little lighter before I print. The biggest problem and most annoying is the door that holds the film in place opens at the slightest touch!! The film has poured out so many times its annoying messy and completely inconvenient.Keep a rubber band around the camera so it doesn't pop open. All in all it's a camera meant for fun. You need time on your hands to fiddle with the settings as well.

Reviews.Author: SalmanBinKhalid
Reviews.Content: Excellent size, light and high quality photographyBut the price is not suitableI love it for ever and ever

Reviews.Title: Kool Camera
Reviews.Author: Americandoofus
Reviews.Content: Great twist on modern and vintage use. Instant pictures or digitial file. The best of both worlds. Camera works well for what I use it 4.

Reviews.Title: Holiday Gift
Reviews.Author: Warren E. Preston
Reviews.Content: Was a gift for our granddaughter. She loves it - compact, clear pictures, very convenient, easy to store in pocket or purse.

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: Nayy
Reviews.Content: This camera is not what I expected! How can something that cost almost 200$ have the quality of a 20$ camera? The pictures print blue.

Reviews.Title: Real Disappointment
Reviews.Author: NAN
Reviews.Content: We ordered this after seeing it featured on a local tv station's "Tech Check."  The photos, although exactly as described, are really, really small.  And our prints had really bad streaks.  We took only 3 shots, and the streaks just got worse.  We returned the camera.

Reviews.Title: Horrible.
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I anticipated the arrival of this product for about a week and I was very excited when it was delivered but was immediately disappointed upon using it for the first time.The body is very cheap. It is very plasitc-y and feels as if it will break easily. The LCD screen is horrible quality as well.The pictures look better on the computer than they do on the screen.My biggest problem was the printing. I was extremely excited and looking forward to this feature only to find out it was completely useless. The prints would come out discolored and low quality. This camera is terrible under low lighting and is just overall a piece of crap.I would not recommend this product to ANYONE. It is a complete piece of s***.

Reviews.Title: I am in love with my camera
Reviews.Author: Kate Heneghan
Reviews.Content: Before purchasing this polaroid I heard some negative reviews due to the "chunkiness" of the camera or the bad quality photos, although I have found no such issue. In fact, I am enjoying this camera more than almost any one I have ever used. The features are mind-blowing! The paper prints so well that it looks old-fashioned still. Although the model is considerably big, I have used original Polaroid models and I love this one so much better!!! Chunky enough to fit in your hands, not small enough and fragile to slip between small cracks and break.

Reviews.Title: Girlfriend is in love with this camera
Reviews.Author: Chris Seltzer
Reviews.Content: Got this as a Christmas present for the girlfriend and she loves it.  Obviously the appeal of the camera is being able to print pictures on the spot and it does that well.  The camera itself is about as good as my cell phone and the colors look a little off.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Digital to Keep & I can Print Pic!!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Sauer
Reviews.Content: Great camera! It was a huge hit at a Christmas Party...I was able to take lots of great pics & print the picture out & give them out to the guests at the party as presents :) When you buy this camera buy a SD card too so you can have lots of pics saved to camera.

Reviews.Title: perfect gift
Reviews.Author: robert
Reviews.Content: my daughter loves it, great for that quick spontaneous picture. and then stick it where you want. easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Fun camera, perfect for capturing our new baby
Reviews.Author: BP
Reviews.Content: So yeah it feels kinda cheap and the screen on the back could be much nicer but it is perfect for capturing the family around the new baby. The camera itself shoots much better pictures than the screen shows and prints are pretty true to color. Also, the camera has enough manual settings to get some really nice shots. I did pull several pics off my computer and loaded them on an Sd card for printing. These turned out incredibly nice and I ended up sticking them to those cheap refrigerator magnet ads and trimming to suit. The result is pretty fun. I am very happy with the Polaroid and reccomend it highly to folks who don't take themselves too seriously. My only other reccomendation is to pair it with a wi-fi sd card so the pics can be shared via email etc

Reviews.Title: pogo polaroid instant photos for art journaling/scrapbooking/travel journaling
Reviews.Author: Therese P. Dignard "North Woods Muse"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. Gives instant photo reference to add to journals for art, travel,  and scrapbooking. Highly recommend this item as a tool or memory captured moment. Inexpensive enough to be great gift for young people. Film sheets have a peel and stick back. Easily fits into my waterproof case for taking out kayaking.After taking a few photos, the mechanism for processing the photos seems to be on the blink and I am getting a white band of mottled colour on the lower half inch of the photo. After twelve prints, I am not getting true colour. The change to a new box of film did not resolve the issue. Therefor, I am returning it for a refund. Wanted to do a replacement, but this seller does not offer this exchange. Will be shipping it out tomorrow and will update for your information when I have the refund in place. Will be posting it with a return notification. Bummer..as it was such a great concept. Bought the printer at the same time, but having difficulty finding a compatible cord for my Android phone or computer, so have not clue if it works yet. I began the review at five stars, but dropped it to three because of printing issues. I don't mind the cheap plastic...just wish it worked. Great, great, great idea.

Reviews.Title: this camera is awesome! but not an "old school" polaroid replacement
Reviews.Author: Tawny
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong this is a great instant print camera, but it just didnt work like an old polaroid it was more like a camera/compact camera printer, you can choose the pictures you want to print, and view them. also, the photo came out printed, there was no waiting for the picture to "develop" which is cool but isnt polaroid-ish.This camera does take awesome pictures though and is definitely fun! makes for a great toy out with friends or parties. has flash options like a regular camera which is great.The AMAZING feature about this camera is that you can take the pictures, print them for small cute wallet size instant pictures, AND save the images to your computer like a digital camera! no needing to scan those tiny little pictures :)

Reviews.Title: Great for Shots on the Go
Reviews.Author: Zoe
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's huge. Yes, it's plastic. BUT, it's awesome! The paper is a bit expensive but what I love about this Polaroid instant camera over other instant cameras (by Fujifilm etc.) is that you can choose which images you print out which means that you save paper and have better memories!

Reviews.Title: So Fun
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This kinda feels like a toy, but what cool, fun gadget isn't. Takes good photos, printing is fun. I love how you can pick which pictures you want, add boarders, edit colors. Nothing protects the lens, so I would suggest getting the case. This camera is easy to use. Easy to figure out. Simple but effective and entertaining.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Sarah Saenz
Reviews.Content: I use this in my classroom. The students LOVE watching their photos print out. I also use the memory card to print out photos taken with my Cannon. It makes a great photo printer for pictures taken with other cameras.

Reviews.Title: old school
Reviews.Author: Victoria
Reviews.Content: This old school camera is perfect for preserving memories and instant prints. a little pricy for being such an outdated version of a camera.

Reviews.Title: didn't like.
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: it's a camera that prints out your pictures, but not a classic polaroid. i bought the fujifilm instax mini 7s for a third of the price and i'm much happier. this is an okay camera, but i feel that there are better out there. i've tried the polaroid 300 and didn't care for it either. the fujifilm cameras are the way to go

Reviews.Title: Tempermental camera
Reviews.Author: D. Halvorsen
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this product five stars. It was great as long as it was working.I purchased this camera to take with me on a trip to Africa. I wanted something that I could leave a photo with the folks I took pictures of. It was great! Then it stopped working, I think because of the heat  and maybe the way electricity works in the country I was visiting. Then it began to print photos again. Toward the end of the trip, I was in an area where there was a lot of dirt in the air and the soil was sandy. The shutter button didn't work. With a bit of effort, a friend and I removed a grain of sand and the camera worked again. Then came the trip home, no problems. Yesterday, I was going to take a photo of my grandson and send it home with him. The printer will not work. My thought is another grain of sand found its way into the printing mechanism and I have no way of getting it out.I love the concept of this camera and will continue using it for photos, but will not be able to print again unless for some reason, the printer starts to work. I'm not holding my breath.

Reviews.Title: poor quality
Reviews.Author: Gocha
Reviews.Content: cover lead where photos are kept is opening automaticaly. when I am locking lead it opens automaticaly again. very poor quality

Reviews.Title: Great product for point and shoot and fun that it prints
Reviews.Author: Ashlyn h
Reviews.Content: Love this little camera.  Great that you can pick and choose which pics to print.  This camera doesnt zoom but I was able to transfer my SD card from another camera into this one and it printed the zoomed in photos.  Great for scarpbooking!

Reviews.Title: its the best ever
Reviews.Author: Marla Grace
Reviews.Content: Fantastic fun easy to use camera that brings fun to any event. I love it and the fact that the photos have an easy peel back making it fun for collage boards. A must have

Reviews.Title: This camera is one of the Best made
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: it is larger then you think trust me but on a good note it does exactly what they said and it does it's job well

Reviews.Title: It's not in the supposed condition
Reviews.Author: sam shawle
Reviews.Content: I bought it new, but i got the item with lots of scratches on the screen. I'm really upset about that. I bought it as a gift for my girlfriend on our anniversary. The thing that drives me crazy is that i can't contact the seller so i can request return. I just regret that i bought it from this seller.

Reviews.Title: Great instant fun
Reviews.Author: gosh p.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just in time for my birthday bash and, overall, it increased the night's fun by the 2nd power! The picture quality was above my expectations and my only complaint is; if it so happens a drink or any other object bumps the picture while it is printing it will cause some smearage or an inconvenient black spot or two. I recommend it for anyone susceptible to mysterious blackouts.

Reviews.Title: my son loves it
Reviews.Author: Yvonne M.
Reviews.Content: it was sent to the wrong address and that person tried to keep it, but we got it thankfully and he is thrilled to have it

Reviews.Title: In love
Reviews.Author: Ida Rettedal Skjæveland
Reviews.Content: I do really love this camera! It's small, digital and you can decide which pictures you want to print, which is awesome in case you take a bad picture. However, it is bigger than i expected, and I don't know if I'm a fan of the entire blue color on the pictures I print ... On the other hand I am completely in love with the camera, it's cute and has good quality :-D

Reviews.Title: What a joke
Reviews.Author: Abd Almajed
Reviews.Content: Its the worst camera ever pictures quality are the worst and everything about this camera is a joke. Plz dont buy

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I've read a handful of reviews on different sites and it seems like people either really love it, or really hate it. In my case, I really love it. It seems like the most complaints I've seen were from people who either think the camera is too big, or picture quality is not that great. I'm assuming these people have never had an actual Polaroid camera. If you compare this camera to the top cameras on the market today, of course you're going to set yourself up for disappointment.Now looking at the camera on a more realistic level of comparison, going from a very large and bulky analog polaroid camera with little to no control of how an image is going to turn out to this--it's quite the difference. This camera is about the nostalgia of a Polaroid exposure with slightly better picture quality and the luxury of choosing which photos you want to print. If you look at the camera from that perspective then you'll understand why I gave it such a great review. It's great for what it is. Don't expect it to be more than that. It's a great, thought out, fun product.

Reviews.Title: I love my new camera.
Reviews.Author: Vickie McNair
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.And being able to have instant photos. And the pouch is a great way to protect and carry the camera andfilm film

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: UQ
Reviews.Content: this was a pretty good buy.. the friend lovedd ita little bulkier than expected. but i guess that's how it would beit's a polaroid for crying out loud.

Reviews.Title: Major issues
Reviews.Author: Amy Britt
Reviews.Content: Was excited for this! But it'd print one picture and then say load paper even though there was an entire pack just loaded in. The photos were blurry no matter how hard we tried to hold it still. Had to send it back sadly.

Reviews.Title: Instant Pictures
Reviews.Author: Jerry1961
Reviews.Content: I thought the unit was a little cheaply made but hope it works well after I get the hang of operating it properly.

Reviews.Title: Birthday present
Reviews.Author: Alma Lisboa
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves her Polaroid.  It is sophisticated looking and easy to work.  The fact that is digital makes a lot better then the old polaroids that required film.

Reviews.Title: so much fun!
Reviews.Author: Loraine Leigh Gallagher
Reviews.Content: I wish you could get the polaroid pictures like you used too, but there are advantages!  I love printing out only what we like and uploading the rest!  My favorite gift by far. I make it special for friends by having little dollar store frames to give along with their picture memories.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Wendi K.
Reviews.Content: I thought the pictures would turn out clearer. Doesn't work well in low light even with the flash. I just expected it to be a little better.  I'm better off taking pictures with my regular camera and making wallet prints at Costco. I liked the sticker effect of the Polaroid, just wish it was better or a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Max Murphy
Reviews.Content: Neat little camera! Takes great photos. Good value and my daughter loves it too! Only problem is the film has to be purchased online.

Reviews.Title: Polaroid z2300
Reviews.Author: claudia
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my 11 year old daughter and she absolutely loves it. It's very easy to use and looks great.

Reviews.Title: 2 thumbs up
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I love this Polaroid it was everything I wanted. It's a great size and it prints perfect Polaroid pictures. Very easy to use as well. You won't regret buying this C=

Reviews.Title: Z2300
Reviews.Author: Carol Wade-Hillis
Reviews.Content: I am happy with this camera, I knew I would when I purchased it.I recommend it to everyone, It is just neat

Reviews.Title: Cheap quality and material.
Reviews.Author: T.G
Reviews.Content: Bought it as a gift. Excited at the beginning but get bored and limited by the product.The best thing about it is the light weight of it, pretty convenient to carry.The pictures are kind of blurry after printing.Find it expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Pat Pennington "book animal"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband for Christmas because he loves different types of cameras. He has had fun with this one. It is a good product and we are enjoying using it.

Reviews.Title: DOES IT LIKE NO OTHER...
Reviews.Author: Akiwo Recheungel
Reviews.Content: THE WIFE IS VERY PLEASED WITH THIS COOL CAMERA.  WE VISIT FRIENDS AND FAMILY AND CAN LEAVE A PIECE OF MEMORY BEHING INSTANTLY.

Reviews.Title: Fun Toy Camera
Reviews.Author: Scott Sasaki
Reviews.Content: It's all the fun of a polaroid with the benefits of digital. Around 50c a print it's cheaper than film polaroids. Includes some filters & frames on the camera itself. Uses a rechargeable battery with a tiny life :(. Still fun though.

Reviews.Title: poor bulid quality
Reviews.Author: Anne Brown
Reviews.Content: switches are poorly assembled and the chrome ring around the lens feel of prior to use.It did produce good quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Mi y Kim
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting a Polaroid camera for a while & received this one for Christmas. Love it! Still trying to figure out some settings, but it's not a disappointment. As a filmmaker, the video option is great to mess around with and, when viewed on a PC, are great quality. Some people have been complaining that it feels a bit flimsy & like a toy camera. Polaroids itself are affordable because they are built to be a bit less sturdy than a regular camera. Love this.

Reviews.Title: Received as a gift, its great!
Reviews.Author: alicia fina
Reviews.Content: The camera is great for what it is. You can not buy this camera thinking your going into a serious camera for any serious needs. Its two items; a camera and printer compressed into one. Ive read complaints about size but you get what you get for what your getting! The plastic feel is a nice strong plastic so it keeps the feeling of it being novelty while feeling of good quality. The 10mp camera is great but don't expect much in low lighting.My complaints are that the menu system is not very organized, the print quality is not what was expected (based on type of paper too) and there is no way to reverse printing. When I say reverse printing, I mean to be able to put photos onto the camera generated by other cameras or computer, and print that out. Im still researching a way to print items that were not generated by the camera, but this thing would be that much more valuable if it could be 'just' a printer.Over all, you cant complain about this little thing. Its novelty is great and if all else fails, you got a nice camera for family outings and the likes.

Reviews.Title: Z2300-Digital instant could be better
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I like the design because it is inspired by the old Polaroid 1000.  It is easy to use . I expected not much but the digital files are of acceptable quality. The prints are small and have a sticky back but color reproduction is not always acceptable* (sometimes bueish, sometimes pinkish). My experience is you get the best results in sunny weather and indoor with flash. Results from scene modes may not give the desired results. A good thing is you only print pictures you like. An extra memory card allows to take more pictures (approx. 2000 on a 4 GB sdhc card). It can also record video, the more light, the better the quality. Forget indoor video. You can also use it as a printer for pictures taken with another camera (jpg format). If you print a lot on the go I would advise to buy an extra battery because printing is power consuming.It is a fun gadget but quality of the camera and prints could be better.*I also have the Z340: if you print a picture taken with the Z2300 on the Z340 it has much better color, so if you hesitate between the Z2300 or Z340 I can recommend the Z340. It is bigger, but a better camera and printer.

Reviews.Title: Does OK, nice to print pictures,
Reviews.Author: David Gray
Reviews.Content: Some nice features, nice to be able to print pictures. Quality is a bit poor. Cell phone take better pictures.

Reviews.Title: its cool - but photos are too small
Reviews.Author: Michal
Reviews.Content: It looks really cool- but the printed paper is too smal and the pictures are very blurry especailly when using the flash light

Reviews.Title: For fun only and not for good quality print
Reviews.Author: Carmelo P. Jalosjos
Reviews.Content: Love this product. It's so convenient to have your picture printed in 1 minute after you take the picture and most of all,  none like other polaroid camera, you have the option to choose the photo you would like to print and its small enough to carry around with you! The only downfall is the print quality. It's not very clear. It has a slight darkness to it but it has an option to brighten your picture however, the image looks distorted. I'm keeping it since it serves the purpose and I figured if I really want a good quality print, I can just print it from the store.

Reviews.Title: Way below expectation. It can just be a toy, not a digital camera...
Reviews.Author: Makoto
Reviews.Content: I did actually purchased the camera. and now I'm going to return it.First of all, the plastic this camera made from feels so cheap. I mean...it supposed to be a camera, not a toy...and the price is near $160...I'm not asking for metal material at this price but it could at least be made from just better plastic. It's hard to pull out the battery cover, and all the buttons are very stiff.the battery charger is almost half size of the camera...and you have to connect it to the camera to charge battery, not take battery out...It's really easy to use, which is a good thing. the steps are easy to follow.It also provides lots of shooting modes. like "sunrise" "fish eye"...However, it is a waste of time to go through those modes by just using the stiff buttons...I don't think it's wise to provide so many shooting modes while it does not have a touch screen.I do not like the LCD screen either. I can't find the info from Polaroid's website but I don't think this LCD has a good quality.The playback function is hard to use too. You'll have to keep click "-" or "+" button to zoom the image...and when it zooms back to the screen size...there's even a effect...like Powerpoint slidesshow effect...which slows down the speedThe most unacceptable issue of this camera, is the image quality it provides.Polaroid promotes its "10MP" resolution...but the reality is...yes, it is "10MP", 3648 x 2736px image. but the file size I got is only 950kb, which basically means the image was saved as a compressed medium quality jpg. [I chose the best quality it can save as...]As a graphic designer who deals with image all the time...what I've learned is, a high quality 3648 x 2736px jpg image normally can take up 3MB space or even more...When I looked at the image on m computer screen, I can actually see the pixel noises. There were lots of color noise and some block noise. I didn't even want to try printing any photo from this camera.I called Polaroid customer service and they said 1MB image is really big and maybe this camera is not for me...I've tried put jpg images taken by an iphone into the SD card, but it can not read the pictures and shows "file error". But then someone figured out it does read photos taken by other cameras as long as the image has full EXIF info.Anyway... I dont recommend this product...unless you really don't care about image quality and just want to snap and print...And I feel sorry for Polaroid...it is going digital but this product can't even provide basic standard quality of digital images. I'd rather stuck with the old Polaroid film cameras...

Reviews.Title: Terrible colour and borders mis-sized
Reviews.Author: GhostBustier
Reviews.Content: While testing this camera out, I took a picture of my daughter and added a border that said "Princess!" When I printed the photo, the colours were washed out, the text on the border was cut off so I could only see 1/3 of it, and the entire image was pixelated. Transfering the photos to my computer showed that while the original photo was 10MP, the print version was only 640 pixels wide (if you don't know anything about printing photos is about 2/3 of what it should be for a 3" print-quality image). When I went to Polaroid's website to check for firmware updates or troubleshooting tips, I found that the camera has been COMPLETELY removed from their site - there is no product page nor support page. If that's not a massive red flag, I don't know what is.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera! "meh" interface
Reviews.Author: Adriana
Reviews.Content: Absolutely LOVE this camera! The only reason it didn't get a 5th star is because of the camera software inside.. its definitely not the best I've experienced. Its difficult to navigate through the menus, but everything is basic enough that if you just play with it, you'll figure it out.Hopefully Polaroid will improve it in future versions!Awesome Camera though!

Reviews.Title: Not a highlander model 80A...
Reviews.Author: logan hall
Reviews.Content: This is not a classic model 80A highlander.... but it is better in another aspectFor the classic polaroid customer, this is not for you...IT IS however for the photographer looking for an innovative and unique product with multiple capabilities.I bought this for my GF and she loves it, plus I get to hook up my GoPro memory card to print out some really cool underwater fish eye shots I captured surfing!! Excellent purchase for both of us!

Reviews.Title: Don't be misled
Reviews.Author: Melzateach
Reviews.Content: This is a fun camera... easy to use. You will need to get a memory card to help with storage of pictures, but all in all a good and fun camera. Note: when you first look at the digital display of a picture, you might question the quality, but when you actually upload it to a computer, the picture quality really cleans up and the pics are great. This is not suppose to be a high end, high resolution camera  - it is suppose to be fun, instant and a great way to have some quick pics. My son printed out a little 2 by 3 picture that he took of he and his brother in law and it is perfect for my wallet.

Reviews.Title: Low quality camera
Reviews.Author: nicholas rollins
Reviews.Content: Poor quality photos even with the more expensive photo paper! Cameras battery only lasted for a few minutes untill you had to recharge.

Reviews.Title: Bulky & poor quality prints
Reviews.Author: beth warbington
Reviews.Content: I did not like this camera very much.  It is bulky to use and the pictures all come out with a yellow hue to them.

Reviews.Title: thanks for all
Reviews.Author: Farid
Reviews.Content: thank youvery quickly realizedeverything is fine and no problemsquality is highThank you for your workI am very pleased with theI hope to work more with you

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: leannakay
Reviews.Content: The camera was everything I expected and some. Works excellent and came in by the ship date. Takes great pictures! I recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: daughter loves it
Reviews.Author: chandra
Reviews.Content: this camera is super fun and my daughter loves it.  the pictures are small but cute.  i think its weird that the white one is more expensive but black looks good too.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant
Reviews.Author: Jroyal81
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait!! The first one got lost or stolen the second one came just in time!! Samys cameras sent another camera out with no hassle and it arrived just in time for Christmas. It's a brilliant camera, and if you see one available but it...they go fast.

Reviews.Title: Wait For Something Better
Reviews.Author: margaret stock
Reviews.Content: A nice idea, but that's about it.  Minuscule photos-more or less the size of a large stamp; that is if you can get the thing to function.  Not comfortable to handle.It went right back.  Be aware that you have to pay the return postage and a hefty restocking fee.I read about it in the NYTimes, which made it sound like manna from heaven.  I was surprised the author was not more discerning.

Reviews.Title: really nice.!
Reviews.Author: Diana Constanza Ordóñez Monroy
Reviews.Content: i love the camera since the day that i saw it, is really easy to use i didn't have any problem with the camera, the only thing is when you print the pic thre is a space in the end of the paper that is not good is weird.

Reviews.Title: Meh.
Reviews.Author: Carla
Reviews.Content: I thought the picture would come out at lot better.The picture gets cropped too if you're not careful enough.It's nice to have for party's and stuff, but I wouldn't recommend this either way.I have my Fujifilm Instax so, I'll just stick with that.

Reviews.Title: Polaroid Z2300 10MP Digital Instant Print Camera (White)
Reviews.Author: Teo Mun Mun Jacqueline
Reviews.Content: Love it, great camera, lots of my friends and colleagues are impressed by it. worth buying, films are cheap too.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: Kelsi Christensen
Reviews.Content: Kind of flimsy and picture quality is not amazing but it's fun to have for a ladies night or fun date night.

Reviews.Title: Cool idea but bad execution.
Reviews.Author: Clayton A. Cohn
Reviews.Content: Got this because I love Polaroids, but the camera is extremely fragile and scratches very easy.Pros: Prints great pictures with stylish borders. You also have access to your photos digitally as well which is not the case with other point-shoot-print cameras.Cons: Breaks easily, fragile, scratches easily, expensive film. Prints are digital, not on film.Bottom line: Not worth it. There are other, cheaper Polaroid cameras that print better pictures on actual film and are much more sturdy.

Reviews.Title: Bulky, ok camera
Reviews.Author: Peter Petkanic "Petky"
Reviews.Content: This camera is huge. Like you need a separate bag just to carry this (exaggerating a bit).The printer is ok, most of the pictures have little tiny lines over them but they were printed out of the camera so it's ok, I guess. I bought this camera for my gf since she always wanted one that has the ability to print pictures - but after using it on several occasions I wish I got one that you have to wait for the picture to show up on the paper.The camera itself is ok, again, just ok.The only thing that really stands out about this camera is its size and price point - both of which aren't pros!If you're deciding to buy one of the instant print cameras I recommend you keep looking.

Reviews.Title: Bad prints.
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: My prints came out streaked. My friend bought a cheaper one and the photo prints are significantly better and without streaks.

Reviews.Title: flimsy
Reviews.Author: HeySamGraham "Sam"
Reviews.Content: for a company that was -or is- on the brink of bankruptcy , this product doesn't seem to try to redeem polaroid. The camera sucks. Picture quality is bad, shutter cant stop action, file sizes are miniscule, the in camera effects look like they're from 2004. The only redeeming quality is the zink printer which is neat, but the cameras materials couldnt be cheaper, and couldnt be more flimsy.if you look at it like a fun toy, that's great. Except, it should cost about 100 dollars cheaper.-Sam

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Jamison Phillips
Reviews.Content: I am so pumped to give this to my girlfriend for her birthday. The price is pretty reasonable and thank good the paper is much cheaper then the vintage polaroids!

Reviews.Title: Shipped quickly!
Reviews.Author: Julie Fuller
Reviews.Content: This camera shipped really quickly and will be a really cool gift!  I am excited to give it as a Christmas gift and capture some memories with it!

Reviews.Title: not a great camera
Reviews.Author: Dot
Reviews.Content: As a Polaroid enthusiast, I was excited to try this new camera. Like others, I have found it very difficult to get a decent quality image from this camera. No matter what the lighting is, it seems like every shot I take with this camera is blurry. It is unusable to me as a camera but I'll keep using it as a printer. I love the sticker paper photos!

Reviews.Title: Need to purchase memory
Reviews.Author: Deborah
Reviews.Content: Pictures are very low quality.  The color on the printed 2X3 is inconsistent, sometimes very orangish.  In order to store a decent amount of photos on the camera you will need to by a memory card in addition to the camera.  My 10 year old loves it though.

Reviews.Title: expensive
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: pricing is better from the polaroid website at 180. but the camera is cool i would just would not buy on here

Reviews.Title: Defective piece!
Reviews.Author: lepeach
Reviews.Content: I'm very unhappy with this camera. Obviously I received defective equipment. It only worked when the camera was plugged in. Once unplugged the camera would shut off and not turn on. I was looking forward to using this on vacation but unfortunately was not able to. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: SweetNightmare
Reviews.Content: I got this for Christmas. I ultimately returned it. The quality and build of the camera is okay at best. The resolution of the screen and low light pictures are terrible. My six year old point and shoot camera gives better quality photos and a better screen than this camera. In the end I can't see how they can justify the cost. It's not worth 200 bux. Awesome concept, fun camera but I wish it cost less.

Reviews.Title: BAD PRINT QUALITY
Reviews.Author: vanessa
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my boyfriend and he was so excited when he opened the box but it is true that the battery does not last long and the worst part of it is that the print quality is terrible.

Reviews.Title: Save your money... look at a different product
Reviews.Author: BellaRue
Reviews.Content: We got this for our teenage daughter's 14th birthday. She used it twice. "something" happened and the LCD is messed up. I called Polaroid customer service (which BTW is a misnomer) who said that cracked crystals are not under warranty nor repairable.  I questioned this happening after such minimal use and Mr. Smarty Pants customer rep. says "They don't break on their own maam."  So, I am thinking that I will spread the word about our $180 worthless piece of junk that really didn't take good pictures anyway... not even as good as a classic polaroid.  Look for a different product and a different company.

Reviews.Title: Print outs do not come out clear
Reviews.Author: S.S. "SS"
Reviews.Content: I was hoping for this digital Polaroid to have a better printing thatn the traditional, but it was not the case.

Reviews.Title: inconsistent quality
Reviews.Author: M. Reilly "shirleyv"
Reviews.Content: the quality of the pictures is so inconsistent.  most of the time when you look at what you are going to photo thepicture is red.  we change settings and do all we can but the picture looks red through the camera eye and thephoto comes out red.  other times the picture quality is great but that is very minor.  probably 1 in 5 is good.we are very disappointed.  we probably are doing something wrong but have not figured it out yet.we were looking forward to many holiday pictures so what a bummer that was.if anyone has any good ideas for us please let me know.  at this point i would not recommend it to anyone.and the pictures are really very small.

Reviews.Title: Blurry, blurry, blurry!
Reviews.Author: TucsonGal
Reviews.Content: I'm nobody's photographer, but just about every shot I take with this camera comes out blurry. From reading the other reviews, I'm thinking either I'm doing something wrong or mine is defective. I just got back from a trip to DC where I used my iPhone as a backup sometimes, and I got much better quality from the iPhone! Sadly, I took most of the pictures with this camera, so I have a LOT of BLURRY pictures of monuments and pictures of people whose facial features are not clear at all. I like the idea of the camera (the printing is pretty awesome, if you can take a picture clear enough to be worth printing) more than the camera itself. I'm not asking for professional quality here, but it should at least be as good as my iPhone, if not better. I'm disappointed there aren't more settings (the point-and-shoot digital camera I bought back in 2006 seems to have more) or it's not intuitively obvious how to use them. I've had this camera for about two months now, and so far I would NOT recommend it.

Reviews.Title: with fabulous features
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Kellum "Christopher J. Kellum"
Reviews.Content: I have lived up to the Polaroid brand camera. Easy to use with fabulous features of blink detection that makes ready everyone with open eyes!

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Patsy Anderson
Reviews.Content: My daughter requested this product last year for x mas but unfortunately I could not find it. This item had sold out, but then again it was about 2 weeks before the holiday. This year I was ahead of the game, I ordered right after Thanksgiving and I received it 2 days later. She is very familiar with various cameras since she has been very much into photography for the last 15 years.

Reviews.Title: Unsatified with picture quailty.
Reviews.Author: Sherry
Reviews.Content: I guess if i bought a camera with a 10 mp, I shouldnt expect much. The quailty of the printed picture is not decent at all. It comes out darker and blurrier. It wasn't as it was described. I would rather buy a nice camera and take the time to have it printed. I would like to also have a instant picture camera but after trying out this one, I think I'm done trying to search for another one.

Reviews.Title: eh
Reviews.Author: Alice.
Reviews.Content: doesnt show pic right when printed. and i think the charged is arleady jacked up because it will not charge

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Subde
Reviews.Content: Usually, it is deemed that low price mean low quality but this digital instant print camera proved it wrong. In fact, it is the biggest reason behind the selection. Tremendous camera with terrific price!

Reviews.Title: Polaroid camera, an excellent fishing sinker
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Turner
Reviews.Content: This Christmas I purchased two items which were both trash! The Microsoft SURFACE tablet and this Polaroid camera. With regard to the camera,its a complete disappointment. The photos it takes on its tiny,3x2 overpriced film are smeary,blurry, out of focus snaps with absolutely no value. In this age of modern electronics, the camera itself is a plastic coated, clunky, over sizepiece of junk with what appears to be a plastic lens. Basicaly made in China junk! Not at all worth $200.bucks in my opinion.A super big disappointment!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Elsie L. Navarro
Reviews.Content: The distinct quality of the camera is nothing other than its' incorporated printer features instant, sharing with no computer connections. It needs only 2x3 full color prints splotch corroboration.

Reviews.Title: More like Printer.
Reviews.Author: AZNC
Reviews.Content: it uses ZINK system different polaroid. its more like printer than polaroid.personally i dont know why anyone would use this. you can just take regular digital camera and print em at cvs or something and will have better quality photos....i miss 4x5 polaroids.

Reviews.Title: hate
Reviews.Author: Denali
Reviews.Content: bought this cause i thought it waould give me that modern hipster vibe but everyone is just making fun of me and think im a freak casue it took pictures of my secrete brothers guts with it

ProductInfo.Features:
In the Box - Instant Digital Camera, 10 sheets of the new premium ZINK Photo Paper, Rechargeable lithium-ion battery, AC adapter/charger, USB cable, Quick Start GuideCamera Features
10 MP digital camera
3.0-inch bright color LCD for viewing images
Compact size and usability
SD compatible for expanded memory, up to 32GB
ProductInfo.Name: Polaroid Z2300 10MP Digital Instant Print Camera (White)
